laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial TG level 4740 mg/dL at age 23; decreased to 1660 mg/dL after 6 months on low fat diet and clofibrate; further decreased to 346 mg/dL three months later; ranged from 250–730 mg/dL during pregnancy; 2992 mg/dL at age 52; decreased to 1548 mg/dL after dietary changes; 2981 mg/dL at age 56; decreased to 266 mg/dL a week after restarting atorvastatin, fenofibrate, and fish oil; 2335 mg/dL at age 57.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Extreme hypertriglyceridemia (TG >2000 mg/dL) on 7 occasions over 35 years, mostly due to dietary and medication non-compliance. Overall compliance resulted in TG mostly below 500 mg/dL.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial total cholesterol 600 mg/dL at age 23; decreased to 478 mg/dL after 6 months on low fat diet; further decreased to 303 mg/dL three months later.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased progressively from 600 mg/dL to 303 mg/dL over a period of approximately 2 years with adherence to diet and medication.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Average fasting glucose over the last 10 years is 112 mg/dL.
Average glycated hemoglobin over the last 10 years is 5.8 ± 0.2%.
Revealed post prandial hyperglycemia with normal insulin levels at age 59.
